revision.text:
{{other ships|HMS Sultan}} {{Infobox military installation | name = HMS Sultan
HMS Siskin
RAF Gosport | ensign= [[File:Naval Ensign of the United Kingdom.svg|90px]] | native_name = | partof = | location = [[Gosport]], [[Hampshire]] | nearest_town = | country = England | image = | alt = | caption = | image2 = | alt2 = | caption2 = | type = | coordinates = {{Coord|50|48|10|N|001|09|39|W|region:GB_type:airport|display=inline,title}} | latd =50 | latm =48 | lats =10 | latNS = N | longd =001 | longm =09 | longs =39 | longEW = W | coordinates_type = airport | coordinates_region = GB | pushpin_map = Hampshire | pushpin_map_caption = Shown within Hampshire | pushpin_label = HMS Sultan | ownership = [[Ministry of Defence (United Kingdom)|Ministry of Defence]] | operator = [[Royal Navy]] | controlledby = | site_other_label = | site_other = | area = | code = | built = {{Start date|1914}} | used = 1914-1945
1945-1956
1956-Present | builder = | materials = | height = | fate = | condition = | battles = | events = | commander = | past_commanders= | garrison = | occupants = | open_to_public = | website = | image3 = | alt3 = | caption3 = | IATA = | ICAO = | FAA = | TC = | LID = | GPS = | WMO = | elevation = {{Convert|7|m|0}} | r1-number = | r1-length = | r1-surface = | airfield_other_label = | airfield_other = | footnotes = }} '''HMS Sultan''' is a shore base of the [[Royal Navy]] in [[Gosport]], [[Hampshire]], England. It is the primary engineering training establishment for the Royal Navy. It is also home to the [[Network Rail]] Advanced Apprenticeship Scheme and the [[EDF Energy]] engineering maintenance apprenticeship. ==History== The site was originally '''RAF Gosport''' it was then transferred to the Royal Navy during 1945 as '''HMS Siskin''' it was then renamed '''HMS Sultan''' on 1 June 1956 when the airfield side was closed down and a Mechanical Repair Establishment was moved here from the Flathouse area by [[Portsmouth Dockyard]].{{cite web|url=http://www.royalnavy.mod.uk/our-organisation/where-we-are/training-establishments/hms-sultan/history|title=History|publisher=Royal Navy (RN)|accessdate=9 December 2014}} The following squadrons were posted here at some point: {{columns-list|2| * [[No. 3 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=24}} * [[No. 5 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=25}} * [[No. 8 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=26}} * [[No. 13 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=28}} * [[No. 14 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=28}} * [[No. 17 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=29}} * [[No. 22 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=31}} * [[No. 23 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=32}} * [[No. 28 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=34}} * [[No. 29 Squadron RAF]].{{sfn|Jefford|1988|p=34}} * Naval Air Squadron]]. * [[1846 Naval Air Squadron]]. * [[1850 Naval Air Squadron]]. }} The following units were posted here at some point: {{columns-list|2| * No. 1 AACU ‘H’ Flight. * No. 1 Coast Artillery Co-operation Flight. * No. 1 Coast Artillery Co-operation Unit. * No. 1 RS. * No. 1 School of Special Flying. * No. 1 Sqn RNAS. * No. 2 AACU. * No. 2 AACU ‘A’ Flight. * No. 2 AACU ‘B’ Flight. * No. 2 AACU ‘D’ Flight. * 7th Wing RFC. * No. 8 AACU. * No. 10 TS. * No. 17 Group Communications Flight. * No. 17 (Training) Group. * 17th Wing RFC. * No. 27 RS. * No. 27 TS. * No. 55 TS. * No. 59 RS. * No. 62 RS. * No. 70 TS. * No. 87 (Canadian) RS. * No. 91 (Canadian) RS. * No. 163 GS. * No. 401 Air Stores Park. * No. 420 (Fleet Spotter) Flight. * No. 421 (Fleet Spotter) Flight. * No. 422 (Fleet Spotter) Flight. * No. 442 (Fleet Reconnaissance) Flight. * No. 449 (Fleet Spotter Reconnaissance) Flight. * No. 460 (Fleet Torpedo) Flight. * No. 460 (Fleet Torpedo Bomber) Flight. * No. 461 (Fleet Torpedo) Flight. * No. 461 (Fleet Torpedo Bomber) Flight. * No. 462 (Fleet Torpedo) Flight. * No. 462 (Fleet Torpedo Bomber) Flight. * No. 463 (Fleet Torpedo) Flight. * No. 464 (Fleet Torpedo) Flight. * No. 1622 (AAC) Flight. * [[Aircraft Torpedo Development Unit]]. * [[Anti-Aircraft Special Defence Flight]]. * [[Coast Defence Development Unit]]. * [[Coastal Battery Co-operation Flight]]. * [[Coastal Battery Co-operation School]]. * [[Composite Co-operation Flight]]. * [[Development Squadron]]. * [[Fleet Air Arm Maintenance Unit]]. * [[Observer Training Flight]]. * [[School of Aerial Co-operation with Coastal Defence Batteries]]. * [[School of Special Flying]]. * [[South Western Area Flying Instructors School]]. * [[Torpedo Development Flight]]. * [[Torpedo Development Section]]. * [[Torpedo Development Unit]]. * [[Torpedo Training Squadron]]. * [[Torpedo Training Unit]]. }} ==Current use== It is the primary engineering training establishment for the Royal Navy. It is also home to the [[Network Rail]] Advanced Apprenticeship Scheme and the [[EDF Energy]] engineering maintenance apprenticeship. It is home to: * Defence School of Marine Engineering * RN Air Engineering and Survival School * Nuclear Department ==See also== * [[List of Royal Navy shore establishments]] ==References== {{Research help|Mil}} ===Citations=== {{Reflist|2}} ===Bibliography=== *{{cite book |last1=Jefford [[Order of the British Empire|MBE]] |first1=[[Wing Commander (rank)|Wg Cdr]] C G |title= RAF Squadrons. A comprehensive record of the movement and equipment of all RAF squadrons and their antecedents since 1912 |year=1988 |publisher= Airlife |location= [[Shrewsbury]] |isbn= 1-85310-053-6 |ref= {{harvid|Jefford|1988}} }} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.royalnavy.mod.uk/our-organisation/where-we-are/training-establishments/hms-sultan}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sultan}} [[Category:Royal Navy bases in Hampshire]] [[Category:Gosport]] [[Category:Royal Navy shore establishments]] [[Category:Training establishments of the Royal Navy]]
